abstracts.cdata!:
The Roads and Bridges Management and
            Maintenance Program Project will adversely impact the
            environment as a result of construction, and operation
            activity in the area. During construction, vegetation and
            fauna habitat losses will be mitigated by clearly marking
            the work areas with pegs, identifying trees for retention,
            and stockpiling shrub foliage for later use as brush layer,
            and seed stock. Soil erosion, and sedimentation will be
            controlled through the construction of diversion banks,
            filter structures - fences of windrowed vegetation - and
            sediment traps, and, in addition, vegetative propagation
            should minimize the disturbed area. Drainage construction
            should take place prior to, during, or immediately following
            road excavation, to minimize scour, and sedimentation, and,
            ensure that borrow pits, drain into sediment traps before
            run-off is discharged off the site. Topsoil saving should be
            the practice, to be re-used on completed road formation
            batters, or areas approved by the Supervision Consultant.
            During operations, afforestation practices should be
            encouraged; sound barriers should be installed to reduce
            noise disturbances; air pollution regulation should be
            enforced, particularly regarding vehicle emissions control;
            and, contingency plans should be in place for clean up of
            oil spills, fuel, and toxic chemicals.
